title: More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Four children, aged 11 and 12, were charged with murder in the fatal beating of Rony Alonso in Providence.
The juveniles also faced charges of disorderly conduct and vandalism after a separate altercation on January 20.
Initial charges of felony assault were upgraded to murder after Alonso died from injuries on January 22, officials stated.

title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Curtis, a 16-year-old Highland steer at Allandale Farm in Boston, died peacefully surrounded by farm staff.
Curtis's death follows the passing of his brother, Willard, both of whom were beloved figures at the farm.
Allandale Farm has invited the public to share memories and photos of Curtis on their website.

title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Boston Red Sox are reportedly considering trading reliever Jordan Hicks for an infielder, with no imminent deal.
Starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval have been discussed in trade talks, with Bello on the block all winter.
The team has shown interest in infielders like Cubs' Nico Hoerner and Astros' Isaac Paredes but may start current players if no trades are made.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots linebacker K'Lavon Chaisson had a standout season with 7.5 sacks and is seeking to re-sign with New England.
Chaisson praised coordinators Josh McDaniels and Zak Kuhr for their roles in the Patriots' defense and Super Bowl run.
Chaisson expressed a strong desire to win Super Bowl LX, especially for defensive coordinator Terrell Williams, recently cancer-free.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months of battling aggressive prostate cancer.
Williams was diagnosed in September and underwent five rounds of chemotherapy at Mass General Hospital.
Head coach Mike Vrabel announced Williams will travel with Patriots for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council unanimously endorsed the Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first Massachusetts city to support this global initiative.
The treaty aims to promote plant-based diets to reduce environmental impact and complement the Paris Agreement on climate change.
Cambridge officials and residents will work to implement plant-based policies, focusing on raising awareness and improving food systems.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara passed away at 71, known for roles in 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone'.
'A Mighty Wind', featuring O'Hara, is available on YouTube, highlighting her performance with Eugene Levy.
'Schitt's Creek', with O'Hara as Moira Rose, is streaming on Hulu and Prime Video.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismisses superstition over Patriots' white uniforms for Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
Patriots have a perfect record of 5-0 in white jerseys this season and 6-0 in 2025.
Super Bowl history shows teams in white jerseys are 37-22 all-time, but Seahawks are 6-0 in navy this season.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: A massive nor'easter will affect Cape Cod and the Islands with 2 to 6 inches of snow expected.
Boston and areas west of I-495 will experience minimal snow, with a coating to 1 inch forecasted.
High winds up to 55 mph on Cape Cod could lead to reduced visibility and potential coastal flooding.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics reportedly unlikely to pursue star players like Giannis Antetokounmpo or Jaren Jackson Jr. before Feb. 5 trade deadline.
Boston may trade Anfernee Simons, who is in the final year of his $27.7 million contract, to match salaries.
Celtics are exploring adding a center like Clippers' Ivica Zubac, amid their limited salary cap space constraints.
